item.title: Bizarre fourth state of water discovered
item.description: Bizarre fourth state of water discovered Scientists at the Oak Ridge National Lab (ORNL) have discovered that when (water) put under extreme pressure in small spaces, the life-giving liquid can exhibit a strange fourth state known as "tunneling". Quantum tunneling means that a particle, or in this case a molecule, can overcome a barrier and be on both sides of it at once â€“ or anywhere in between. Think of rolling a ball down one side of a hill and up another.
